Max Fried (9-8, 3.35 ERA) vs. Jake Irvin: Max Fried’s season with the Braves has been quite wonderful as he has a season ERA of 3.35 and a WHIP of 1.19 over 147.2 innings pitched in the season
Fried has 138 strikeouts this season, and only 51 of those are walks, which is an indication that he knows how to work the plate
For the Nationals, Jake Irvin is an entirely different proposition as he has a season-earned run average of 4.28 and a WHIP of 1.21
Though he has managed to strike out 140 batters this season he has also given up 26 home runs and that is a number that may work against the long-hitting Braves
MLB Odds/Point Spread: Atlanta Braves -1: The current betting odds favor the Braves, reflecting their superior season performance and playoff aspirations

Washington Nationals Betting Trends: The Nationals have seen a mix of overs and unders in their recent outings, but their home performance, particularly their inability to secure wins (1-4 SU in last 5 home games), indicates potential vulnerabilities that the Braves could exploit
Atlanta Braves vs. Washington Nationals: The analysis and betting trends indicate that the Atlanta Braves have an overwhelming advantage over the Washington Nationals in this upcoming game
